LoginLdap.PluginDescription: Login plugin with LDAP authentication. Provides an alternative to the standard Piwik Login plugin.
LoginLdap.LoadUserDescription: Search user in LDAP directory and add to piwik if found.
LoginLdap.AliasFieldDescription: The LDAP attribute used to generate a user's Piwik alias, e.g. "cn".
LoginLdap.MailFieldDescription: The LDAP attribute containing a user's e-mail address, e.g. "mail".
LoginLdap.UserIdFieldDescription: The LDAP attribute containing a user's username, e.g. "uid", or for Active Directory: "userPrincipalName".
LoginLdap.UsernameSuffixDescription: Appended to usernames to generate e-mail addresses for users that have none in LDAP. Set to, e.g., "@localhost.com".
LoginLdap.AdminUserDescription: User with access to other user entries, or or blank for anonymous bind.
LoginLdap.MemberOfDescription: A group the user is required to be a member of, e.g. "cn=Piwik User,cn=Users,dc=organization,dc=com".
LoginLdap.FilterDescription: An LDAP filter used to determine which entities are allowed to be used for authentication, e.g. "(objectClass=person)".
LoginLdap.Kerberos: Use Web Server Auth (e.g. Kerberos SSO)
LoginLdap.LogEmpty: Log file seems to be empty
LoginLdap.LdapExtensionMissing: The PHP LDAP extension does not appear to be enabled. It is required for this plugin, please install it.
LoginLdap.autoCreateUser: Add users if they match LDAP user settings
LoginLdap.CannotConnectToServer: Could not connect to the LDAP server.
LoginLdap.CannotConnectToServers: Could not connect to any of the %s LDAP servers.
LoginLdap.MemberOfCount: %s are a member of this group.
LoginLdap.ServerNameEditInstructions: To edit a server name, click it.
LoginLdap.FirstNameFieldDescription: The LDAP attribute containing a user's first name.
LoginLdap.LastNameFieldDescription: The LDAP attribute containing a user's last name.
LoginLdap.FirstLastNameForAlias: The first and last name are used to generate an alias if one cannot be found in LDAP.
LoginLdap.NewUserDefaultSitesViewAccess: Initial Sites With View Access For New Users
LoginLdap.NewUserDefaultSitesViewAccessDescription: If specified, when an LDAP user is synchronized for the first time (s)he is given view access to these sites. Should be set to a list of IDs or 'all'.
LoginLdap.EnableLdapAccessSynchronization: Enable User Access Synchronization from LDAP
LoginLdap.EnableLdapAccessSynchronizationDescripti: If enabled, user access levels are determined by custom LDAP attributes. Note: To use this feature you will have to modify your LDAP server's schema.
LoginLdap.LdapViewAccessFieldDescription: The custom LDAP attribute that determines which sites a user has view access to.
LoginLdap.LdapAdminAccessFieldDescription: The custom LDAP attribute that determines which sites a user has admin access to.
LoginLdap.LdapSuperUserAccessFieldDescription: The custom LDAP attribute that determines whether a user is a superuser or not.
LoginLdap.LdapUserAccessAttributeServerSpecDelimit: User Access Attribute Server Specification Delimiter
The string used to delimit server specifications in a user access attribute. If set to ';', the access attribute will be expected to look like '<server-spec>;<server-spec>;...'.
LoginLdap.LdapUserAccessAttributeServerSeparator: User Access Attribute Server & Site List Separator
LoginLdap.LdapUserAccessAttributeServerSeparatorDe: The string used to separate Piwik server instance IDs with site ID lists. If set to ':', the access attribute will be expected to look like '<server-id>:<site-list>;<server-id>:<site-list>'.
LoginLdap.ThisPiwikInstanceName: Special Name For This Piwik Instance
LoginLdap.ThisPiwikInstanceNameDescription: A special name used to identify this Piwik instance in an access attribute. If none is specified, we expect the base URL of this Piwik.
LoginLdap.UnsupportedPasswordReset: Cannot reset this user's password, please contact an administrator.
